div.h3: COVID-19 Office Closures, Schedule Changes and Cancellations

p.strong: We will continue to update cancellations and schedule changes on our Facebook and Twitter accounts as well as our this page on our website.

div.p:
Please click on the link below to read the Update and Statement pertaining to businesses from Dr. Gary Voccio, Health Director for the Georgia Department of Health
COVID-19 Update and Statement on Businesses Remaining Open

All Senior Activities will be cancelled for two weeks:
The Transit system will still be able to take people to doctor’s appointments and keep their regular schedule.
For questions, call Annette Cash at 706-657-8277.

As per the Superintendent of School Dr. Jan Harris: Dade County Schools will be closed March 16-27. Digital Learning will continue during this time. More information will follow tomorrow. School will be in session Friday, March 13. .
To see more from Dade County Schools check out their website at https://www.dadecountyschools.org/
Courts: Lookout Mountain Judicial Circuit (Catoosa, Chattooga, Dade & Walker Counties) State of Georgia - makes Declaration of Judicial Emergency. This will have a bearing on our local courts.

Supreme Court
Harold D. Melton, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Georgia, has issued an Order Declaring Statewide Judicial Emergency, which is currently in effect until April 13, 2020.The Courts have been directed to provide essential functions and limit all non-essential functions. Click on the link to read more Supreme Court Notice

br.a: Office procedures for Clerk of Superior Court

div.p: NOTICE: 2020 Mobile Home Taxes due date has been extended from April 1 to May 1, 2020. You can mail payment to PO Box 349, Trenton GA 30752 or pay online at dadecountypay.com. We also have a Dropbox on the outside of the Administration building. Any questions, contact the Tax & Tag Office at 706-657-7563.

Angie Moreland Galloway
Dade County Georgia
Chief Deputy Tax Commissioner
PO Box 349
Trenton, Ga 30752
706 657 7563
angiegalloway@dadecounty-ga.gov
4-H activities are canceled through March 27th, 2020. This includes all S.A.F.E. Shooting Sports practices (BB, .22, and Shotgun), poultry judging, forestry club, and gardening club. District, area, and state 4-H events will be decided by state 4-H administration. As information becomes available on these upcoming events, we will let everyone know. We will also be POSTPONING our Bull’s-Eye Challenge. A reschedule date is yet to be determined, but we will announce the date as soon as we can appropriately schedule it.
Voting is closed at the Administration Building in Trenton. Check this page for more info: http://www.dadecounty-ga.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=64

The Dade County Public Library is closed for the rest of the month per Library Director Marshanna Sharp. For more information call the library at 706-657-7857 or visit their website at https://www.chrl.org/dade-county-public-library/ (NOTE: The Library will be open Tuesday, March 17th from 10:00 am - 6:00 pm)

City of Trenton, Georgia- Please click on the following link to see more about the Public Notice from the City of Trenton City of Trenton Public Notice
Fore more information see the City’s website at https://trentonga.gov/government 706-657-4167

According to Dade County Executive Ted Rumley - All Dade County Government offices and departments are open for regular business hours and are not expected to close unless stipulated by Governor Kemp.
Here are the direct numbers to our most frequently called departments or offices:

Board of Commissioners - 706-657-4625
Elections - 706-657-8170
Tags / Taxes - 706-657-7563
DFACS - 706-657-7511
Parks & Recreation Facilities - for questions please contact Director Stacy Stephens at 423-290-8415
(Dade County does not decide if recreation leagues will be suspended; that determination is left to the discretion of the league director.)
Dade County Rec Baseball FB Page
Dade County Soccer Association FB Page
Transfer Station - 706-657-2776
Health Department -706-657-4213
Public Transportation - 706-657-8277
Public Library - 706-657-7857
Superior Court - 706-657-7131
Probate Court - 706-657-4414
Magistrate Court - 706-657-4113
Juvenile Court - 706-657-6056
GA Driver License Renewal - 706-657-2812

City of Trenton - 706-657-4167
Dade County Schools - 706-657-4361

strong.span: Important Message from Trenton Telephone Company

p.br: Effective March 19 we will be closing our front lobby until further notice. Please call and we will help you over the phone.

div.p: There will be no interruption of services due to nonpayment during the state of emergency but customers will need to contact our office to set up payment arrangements.
We offer many ways for you to pay your bill without leaving home. At this time, we ask that you use one of these methods listed below whenever possible.

You can easily pay your bill by mail to Trenton Telephone Company PO Box 216, Trenton, GA 30752. Call our office at 706-657-4367 to make a debit or credit card payment or go online to www.tvn.net and click on the blue link at the top of the page that reads PAY MY BILL.

To help out students while they are out of school, we are setting up hot spots at the following locations for them to use for digital learning. The locations will be Veterans Part (beside the library and jail), White Oak Baptist Church parking lot and New Salem Community Center parking lot. The hours for these spots will be 8 am to 8 pm. The wifi network name will show up on your device as TVNTTC2.4g or TVNTTC5g. There will not be a password required to use this service.
The health and safety of the employees and customers of Trenton Telephone Company is out top priority during this outbreak or coronaviris (COVID-19)
If you have any questions or concerns please call our office at 706-657-4367.
